metadata.title: CVE-2021-4008 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server in versions before 21.1.2 and before1.20.14. An out-of-bounds access can occur in theSProcRenderCompositeGlyphs function. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
xdmx-tools - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
xnest - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
xorg-server-source - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
xserver-common - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
xvfb - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm5').
